alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong gusty winds will impact portions of western Weld, southeastern Larimer and Boulder Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers and thunderstorms, extending from near Jamestown to near Eldorado Springs, or along a line extending from 36 miles southwest of Fort Collins to 21 miles northwest of Denver. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boulder, Longmont, southwestern Loveland, Lafayette, Louisville, Erie, Firestone, Frederick, Berthoud, Dacono, Mead, Lyons, Jamestown, Raymond, Crisman, Eldorado Springs, Pinewood Springs, Gold Hill, Sunshine, and Masonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
